etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in George M'Gowan (b. 1853). From propane + di- + -ol, originally after German Propandiol

definitions: Either of two isomeric liquid alcohols; = "propylene glycol".

notes.text: Formula: CH₂(OH)CH(OH)CH₃ (more fully 1,2-propanediol) and CH₂(OH)CH₂CH₂OH (more fully 1,3-propanediol).
